intro: Lindsaea balansae, commonly known as the Balansae filmy fern, is a species of epiphytic fern belonging to the family Lindsaeaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows on trees or rocks in humid environments. The plant is characterized by its delicate, translucent fronds that are often covered in a fine layer of hair. Its reproductive structures, known as sporangia, are clustered in small, spore-producing clusters called sori. Lindsaea balansae plays an important ecological role in its habitat by contributing to the biodiversity of epiphytic plant communities.
